Article Name: The AI Bubble Paradox: Why OpenAI's $500 Billion Valuation Proves The Opposite
Description: Sam Altman warns of an AI bubble even as OpenAI nears a $500B valuation—signaling short-term froth but long-term infrastructure revolution.

Article Name: Is The AI Bubble Bursting? Lessons From The Dot-Com Era
Description: AI’s rapid rise mirrors the dot-com era, with soaring valuations, heavy data center spending and investor concerns over a possible bubble.

Article Name: Why Nvidia Earnings Matter More To Markets Than What The Fed Chair Says
Description: Investors know what the Fed chair is likely to say. But uncertainty over Nvidia's earnings could worry investors concerned about an AI bubble.

Article Name: Are We Too Chummy With AI? Seemingly Conscious AI Is Messing With Our Heads
Description: The coming wave of AI will not just speak fluently or generate images on command. It will seem conscious. That's a problem, warns Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman.

Article Name: Anthropic’s Claude AI Can Now End Abusive Conversations For ‘Model Welfare’
Description: Anthropic’s new feature for Claude Opus 4 and 4.1 flips the moral question: It’s no longer how AI should treat us, but how we should treat AI.

Article Name: Anthropic’s Higher Ed AI Board Signals Shift From Tools To Guardrails
Description: Anthropic’s new higher-ed advisory board and AI fluency courses reveal where campus AI is heading: policy, skills, integrity and responsible deployment.

Article Name: Reinventing ERP With Event-Driven Agentic AI
Description: ERP systems are shifting from static and reactive to dynamic, event-driven platforms powered by agentic AI, enabling them to execute complex workflows autonomously.

Article Name: A Smart Clothes Business For The AI Age
Description: An example of applied AI in retail shows us how smart clothes might act in the near future.

Article Name: ProSocial AI Meets Islamic Finance: Values-Driven Tech Revolution
Description: ProSocial AI and Islamic finance come from different contexts, yet share a commitment to justice and human wellbeing that may reshape how we think about technology in finance.

Article Name: Sam Altman Says That Less Than 1% Of User-AI Relationships Are Unhealthy But That’s Still Jittery For Far-Flung Mental Health
Description: Sam Altman said that less than 1% of user-AI relationships are unhealthy. Is that small or should we be worried? Far-flung mental health is at stake. An AI Insider scoop.

Article Name: AI Is Changing The Rules Of Web Traffic — A GEO Playbook For Online Retailers
Description: AI assistants like ChatGPT, Claude and Perplexity are reshaping retail. Generative engine optimization beats SEO. A playbook for online retailers.

Article Name: AI Hype And Fear Miss The Point—Reality Is In The Middle
Description: AI isn’t magic or snake oil. It’s a tool—powerful but imperfect. Real progress comes from using it wisely, with context, skepticism, and balance.

Article Name: 3 Uncomfortable Questions For Target’s New CEO
Description: The longtime insider needs candor, clarity and courage to revitalize the retailer.

Article Name: InnovationRx: Phil Knight’s $2 Billion Cancer Gift
Description: In this week’s edition of InnovationRx, we look at Phil Knight’s big cancer gift, Medallion’s credentialing clearinghouse, a new treatment for fibromyalgia, and more.

Article Name: Black Hat USA 2025: The Year Of The Enterprise Browser
Description: This year's Black Hat conference focused on the use of AI in both cyber attacks and cyber defenses, with secure enterprise browsers emerging as a key defense mechanism.

Article Name: The Creepy Butler: Metrics, Stories And Theories At AI 2027
Description: Robots as butlers seem useful, but by 2027, fast AIs may lie, scheme, and fuel global power struggles, warns the AI Futures Project.

Description: The first AI-powered billion-dollar solo startup is coming by 2028 driven by AI agents, no-code tools, and global digital distribution

Article Name: Hospitals Are Betting On AI To Transform Neurological Diagnosis
Description: AI is moving into healthcare as hospitals push at-home neurological diagnostics. The promise is real but the path is complex.

Article Name: Elon Musk’s Self-Driving Tesla Lies Are Finally Catching Up To Him
Description: For nearly a decade Elon Musk has claimed Teslas can truly drive themselves. They can’t. Now California regulators, a Miami jury and a new class action suit are calling him on it.

Article Name: What Is Quantum As A Service And Why Does It Matter For Your Business
Description: Quantum-as-a-Service is making the revolutionary power of quantum computing accessible without the need for million-dollar hardware investments or specialized facilities.
